results.title: Arou
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
In this film, a map locates Arou, a tribal area of the Duna people, in the New Guinea highlands between the Central and Muller Ranges. The traditional economy of the people is shown to be almost self-sufficient. Sweet potatoes are the staple food and pigs are the main form of wealth. The lifting of entry restrictions in 1964 allowed European contact to be made with these people and the resulting changes in the economy and some problems now facing the Duna people are revealed. Suitable for Social Studies and Geography. No other credits available.

results.title: What makes clouds
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner, Frederic Goodich and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Fogs and cloud are composed of droplets of water. This film conducts an experiment with condensation producing fog in a bottle and concludes with an investigation of how condensation occurs in nature.

results.title: What makes the wind blow?
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
This film studies the causes of a typical onshore sea breeze and a violent wind storm. It shows laboratory experiments designed to discover the possible causes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Erosion: levelling the land
results.creator_credit: H William Varney, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Uses laboratory demonstrations and natural photography to investigate the processes of weathering, erosion and deposition of rock materials. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Waves on water
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Gary Lopez and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Uses large experimental tanks to show that waves approaching shore bend to conform to the coastline. Also points out that high energy waves are created by underwater earthquakes.

results.title: Mars the Viking Mission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Looks at the five successful American missions to Mars that have taken place since 1964, discussing how advances in photography have improved scientists’ ability to identify small features on Mars. Also discusses the work performed by two laboratories which have been landed on Mars to analyse soil, test for existence of life and record weather conditions.

results.title: Why do we still have mountains
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner, American Geological Institute and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Explains how mountains are formed by deformation of the Earth’s crust, showing that uplifting movements are occurring at present, and new elevations replace those being eroded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner, American Geological Institute and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Rocks that originate underground
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Explains the formation of typical igneous and metamorphic rocks and the conditions under which they are formed according to indirect evidence. Also, the program investigates the requirements for the formation of intergrown crystalline mineral grains. Suitable for Upper Primary and Lower Secondary.

results.title: Rocks that form on the Earth's surface
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Explains the formation of sandstone and shale as typical sedimentary rocks, the process of compaction and cementation and the formation of limestone and coal. Uses examples and demonstrations to enhance the explanations.
